title: Security Engineering Intern
requirements:
Security Engineering Intern
Remote, United States

Your goal - to improve the education process and better the lives of students by helping to secure our products and services that help students get better grades.

Organization: Security

Information Security at Chegg provides a trusted experience for our students and protects our employees, systems and intellectual property.

Our Information Security team is composed of several roles from incident response to application security to risk management, each necessary to ensure the business can function effectively while minimizing risk.

Role: Security Engineering Internship

The Candidate Will Be Responsible For

Chegg is seeking an exceptional, passionate, collaborative Security Engineering intern to contribute to our security program.
• Reproducing security vulnerabilities discovered internally and reported to us by customers and researchers.
• Helping identify the root cause of security vulnerabilities in our codebase and collaborating with Engineering to resolve them.
• Assisting in carrying out incident response duties such as investigations and threat hunting.
• Documenting any identified security risks.

Opportunities
• Help secure a company that millions of students love
• Explore multiple career paths in information security
• 1:1 mentorship from our experienced team
• Guidance from executives in Chegg

Requirements
• Be legally allowed to work in the US (US citizen, green card, or F1 student visa holder)
• Be able to work 40 hours per week
• Have a strong, demonstrable interest in Information Security
• Have a passion for understanding how software is built and how technologies work under the hood
• Ability to automate solutions to repeatable tasks
• Effectively work in a team environment as well as autonomously
• Strong critical thinking and analytical skills
What project will the intern work on?
The candidate will participate in the day to day tasks that the Information Security team carries out such as reproducing security vulnerabilities reported to externally and investigating potential security risks so they can get a feel for the many different facets our job entails. They will also work on a project - typically an internal tool that will help the team scale. The specifics of the project will be decided once we learn more about our intern’s skill set and interests. The breakdown of time will be roughly 60% project to 40% day to day tasks.

What skills will the intern gain?
• They will gain an understanding of the different types of roles on an information security team.
• They will gain an understanding of application security issues and how to find them, triage them and remediate them.
• They will gain an understanding of how and when to automate tasks.
This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.
